name: Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES)
details: with the right cable, the SNES will output an RGB signal without modification with exception to the SNES Jr. This is also true for the Super Famicom.

name: Sega Mega Drive/Genesis
details: with the right cable, the Genesis/Mega Drive will output an RGB signal without modification with exception of the Model 3 which needs a small mod to do this. Model 1, Model 2, and the CDX all output RGB without modification.

name: Sega Master System
details: with the right cable, the Master System model 1 will output an RGB signal without modification. The Master System 2 requires a modification to do this.

name: Sega Saturn
details: with the right cable, all models of the Saturn will output an RGB signal without modification.

name: Nintendo GameCube
details: with the component cable, the GameCube model DOL-001 with the digital video connection will output RGB.

name: Sega Dreamcast
details: with an RGB cable or VGA cable, the Dreamcast will output RGB without modification

name: Nintendo Wii
details: with a component cable, the Wii will output RGB without modification

name: Atari Jaguar
details: with an adapter that connects to the pin output on the back of the Jaguar, you can use either a SCART cable or component cable to get an RGB signal form the Jaguar without modification.

name: NEC TurboGrafx 16
details: with an adapter for the pin output on the back, all PC Engine and TurboGrafx-16 consoles can output RGB without any modification. The Duo requires modification to do this.

name: SNK Neo Geo AES
details: with the right cable, all versions of the Neo Geo can output RGB without modification.

name: Philips CD-i
details: the PAL version of the CD-i has a SCART connector and can output RGB without any modification. All other versions of the CD-i require a modification to do this.

name: Microsoft Xbox
details: with a component cable, the Xbox can output RGB without modification

name: Sony PlayStation
details: with the right cable, the PlayStation will output an RGB signal without modification

name: Sony Playstation 2
details: with the right cable, the PlayStation 2 will output an RGB signal without modification

name: Sony Playstation 3
details: with the right cable, the PlayStation 3 will output an RGB signal without modification
